issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Since the '5s sleep' is for the purpose to let clients know the final states, put it after other services are stopped and only before stopping ClientService is enough. This can reduce some race conditions like MAPREDUCE-5471
fields.summary: '5s sleep'  in MRAppMaster.shutDownJob is only needed before stopping ClientService

comments.body: upload a patch that moves the '5s sleep' to after other services are stopped and before ClientService is stopped/

Quick comments on the patch:
 - Change ClientService to extend Service. That way you don't need the type-casting in MRAppMaster.
 - The start of client-service in MRAppMaster.serviceStart() should not be under the condition for errorHappenedShutDown.
 - Fix formatting in the changes done for MRApp.java
 - Can you move the checks for JobHistoryEventHandler and ClientService into a stand-alone test say TestMRAppComponentDependencies or something similar? They don't belong to the staging-cleanup test.

upload a new patch that fix the comments.
Still keep client-service under the condition for errorHappenedShutDown as the client-service is not inited if errorHappenedShutDown is true. Also add a comment there.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #4399 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/4399/])
MAPREDUCE-5497. Changed MRAppMaster to sleep only after doing everything else but just before ClientService to avoid race conditions during RM restart. Contributed by Jian He. (vinodkv: http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1521699)

* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-app/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/v2/app/client/ClientService.java

Does the client service return job succeeded status after the services have stopped or as soon as jobimpl succeeds? If we wait till after the services have stopped, then we can be sure that the user will be notified of success only when the job is really done. Any unexpected incident during unregister etc can be handled internally as appropriate because the user still thinks that the job is running. After that we can sleep for 5 secs for the user to connect and read the status.
